body_html:
2652704 changed the behavior of tf.app.run() to look at sys.argv and attempt to parse the flags using absl.flags.

As a workaround, you can pass an empty list of args to tf.app.run():

if __name__ == '__main__':
  tf.app.run(argv=[])

@martinwicke @yilei This seems like it might be a breaking change for existing users of argparse. Should we find a way to make this optional before it gets into a release?
body:
2652704b576adc16b4d735f651cea1024e88b72e changed the behavior of `tf.app.run()` to look at `sys.argv` and attempt to parse the flags using `absl.flags`.

As a workaround, you can pass an empty list of args to `tf.app.run()`:

```python
if __name__ == '__main__':
  tf.app.run(argv=[])
```

@martinwicke @yilei This seems like it might be a breaking change for existing users of `argparse`. Should we find a way to make this optional before it gets into a release?
